title: Inting and death threat combo!

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body: Dude went 0/19 which is straight up inting in its own right and I'm pretty sure that gets picked up, but could anyone offer insight into whether post-game messages are ever audited? This shit's just not on haha, especially given we'd been subjected to a 4v6.

replies.body:
Honestly riot doesnt care.

Infact i guarantee they are going to censor this post to remove evidence of him thanks to their no naming and shaming policy.

Yeap, the system will pick up intentional feeding like that as long as you reported him :D 

As for post-game chat messages it's far more complicated:

+ Post and pre game chats are definitely collected and recorded. If you leave a brief report comment saying _"he made death threats in the post-game chat"_, then a Rioter who reviews your report can easily bring up those chats and punish them for it.  


+ But sometimes it will be the Instant Feedback system that reviews your report. The [information](http://support.lol.garena.com/en_SG/articles/542-#h3q1) that's currently available seems to indicate that Instant Feedback does check post and pre game chat, but TBH it seems a little bit vague to me.

Good news is though, that in this case it doesn't matter if the Instant Feedback system detects post-game chat or not. 

Instant Feedback punishes both feeding and toxic behaviour with one punishment. So this player will still get the same punishment for just feeding, as they would for feeding + toxic chat. _(note; this doesn't work the other way around)_

I've left a few things out to keep this post relatively short, so if you have any questions feel free to ask and I can explain more :D

>Post and pre game chats are definitely collected and recorded. If you leave a brief report comment saying "he made death threats in the post-game chat", then a Rioter who reviews your report can easily bring up those chats and punish them for it.

Read "They don't normally check post game chat, so you have to actually tell them this, because if you don't they get away with this behaviour"

I'm not a Rioter, so I have no idea what they do and don't check. 

Most likely they'll use common sense and bring up pre and post-game chat when they can't find evidence in the in-game chat. That said, there's no harm in letting them know anyway.

Was death threats, but as for intentional feeding sadly you're at a loss, yasuo players are simply just that bad.

Also make it a little fancy brah, use eyedropper to get the tone and colour of the background and use the b lockout boxes with that, looks a lot nicer
